instruction: Create a Blueprint that pressing Interact toggles physics simulation on and off using SetSimulatePhysics.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_PhysicsToggle
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Interact"]
NODE n2: FlipFlop
NODE n3: SetSimulatePhysics [Simulate=true]
NODE n4: SetSimulatePhysics [Simulate=false]
EXEC n1.Pressed -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.A -> n3.Execute
EXEC n2.B -> n4.Execute
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_ToggleSimulation
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Interact"]
NODE n2: FlipFlop
NODE n3: SetSimulatePhysics [Simulate=true]
NODE n4: SetSimulatePhysics [Simulate=false]
EXEC n1.Pressed -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.A -> n3.Execute
EXEC n2.B -> n4.Execute }
raw_output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_ToggleSimulation
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Interact"]
NODE n2: FlipFlop
NODE n3: SetSimulatePhysics [Simulate=true]
NODE n4: SetSimulatePhysics [Simulate=false]
EXEC n1.Pressed -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.A -> n3.Execute
EXEC n2.B -> n4.Execute }

instruction: Create a Blueprint that on Tick moves the actor forward by 2 units per frame using AddActorLocalOffset.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_SlowMover
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: AddActorLocalOffset [DeltaLocation=(X=2.0,Y=0,Z=0)]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_MovingForward
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: GetWorldDeltaSeconds
NODE n3: MultiplyFloat [B=2.0]
NODE n4: MakeVector [Y=0.0, Z=0.0]
NODE n5: AddActorLocalOffset
EXEC n1.Then -> n5.Execute
DATA n1.DeltaSeconds -> n3.A [Float]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.X [Float]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.DeltaLocation [Vector] }
raw_output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_MovingForward
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: GetWorldDeltaSeconds
NODE n3: MultiplyFloat [B=2.0]
NODE n4: MakeVector [Y=0.0, Z=0.0]
NODE n5: AddActorLocalOffset
EXEC n1.Then -> n5.Execute
DATA n1.DeltaSeconds -> n3.A [Float]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.X [Float]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.DeltaLocation [Vector] }

instruction: Create a Blueprint that on overlap teleports the overlapping actor to location (0, 0, 500) using SetActorLocation.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_Teleporter
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n2: MakeVector [X=0, Y=0, Z=500]
NODE n3: SetActorLocation
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n1.OtherActor -> n3.Target [Actor]
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.NewLocation [Vector]
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_TeleportOnOverlap
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n2: GetWorldLocation
NODE n3: Vector_MakeFromRotator [Rotation=(Pitch=90)]
NODE n4: AddVector [A=(X=0,Y=0,Z=500), B=<None>]
NODE n5: SetActorLocation [NewLocation=<None>]
EXEC n1.Then -> n5.Execute
DATA n1.OtherActor -> n5.Target [Actor]
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.Rotator [Rotator]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.A [Vector]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.NewLocation [Vector] }
raw_output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_TeleportOnOverlap
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n2: GetWorldLocation
NODE n3: Vector_MakeFromRotator [Rotation=(Pitch=90)]
NODE n4: AddVector [A=(X=0,Y=0,Z=500), B=<None>]
NODE n5: SetActorLocation [NewLocation=<None>]
EXEC n1.Then -> n5.Execute
DATA n1.OtherActor -> n5.Target [Actor]
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.Rotator [Rotator]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.A [Vector]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.NewLocation [Vector] }

instruction: Create a Blueprint with a vector variable TargetLocation. On Tick, lerp the actor's position toward TargetLocation at alpha 0.05.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_SmoothMover
PARENT: Actor
VAR TargetLocation: Vector
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: GetActorLocation
NODE n3: VariableGet [VarName=TargetLocation]
NODE n4: Lerp [Alpha=0.05]
NODE n5: SetActorLocation
EXEC n1.Then -> n5.Execute
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n4.A [Vector]
DATA n3.Value -> n4.B [Vector]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.NewLocation [Vector]
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_SmoothFollow
PARENT: Actor
VAR TargetLocation: Vector = (X=0,Y=0,Z=0)
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=TargetLocation]
NODE n3: Lerp [Alpha=0.05]
NODE n4: SetActorLocation
EXEC n1.Then -> n4.Execute
DATA n1.DeltaSeconds -> n3.Alpha [Float]
DATA n2.Value -> n3.A [Vector]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.NewLocation [Vector] }
raw_output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_SmoothFollow
PARENT: Actor
VAR TargetLocation: Vector = (X=0,Y=0,Z=0)
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=TargetLocation]
NODE n3: Lerp [Alpha=0.05]
NODE n4: SetActorLocation
EXEC n1.Then -> n4.Execute
DATA n1.DeltaSeconds -> n3.Alpha [Float]
DATA n2.Value -> n3.A [Vector]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.NewLocation [Vector] }

instruction: Create a Blueprint that on Hit adds an impulse in the opposite direction of the hit normal multiplied by 500.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_Bouncer
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Hit
NODE n2: MultiplyFloat [B=-500.0]
NODE n3: AddImpulse
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n1.HitNormal -> n2.A [Vector]
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.Impulse [Vector]
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_ReflectImpulse
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Hit
NODE n2: GetHitNormal
NODE n3: MultiplyFloat [B=500.0]
NODE n4: AddImpulse
EXEC n1.Then -> n4.Execute
DATA n1.HitNormal -> n2.Target [Vector]
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.A [Float]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.Impulse [Vector] }
raw_output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_ReflectImpulse
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Hit
NODE n2: GetHitNormal
NODE n3: MultiplyFloat [B=500.0]
NODE n4: AddImpulse
EXEC n1.Then -> n4.Execute
DATA n1.HitNormal -> n2.Target [Vector]
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.A [Float]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.Impulse [Vector] }

instruction: Create a Blueprint with two vector variables PointA and PointB and a boolean AtA starting true. On Tick, if AtA is true move toward PointA, otherwise move toward PointB. When distance to target is less than 50, flip AtA.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_Patrol
PARENT: Actor
VAR PointA: Vector
VAR PointB: Vector
VAR AtA: Bool = true
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=AtA]
NODE n3: Branch
NODE n4: VariableGet [VarName=PointA]
NODE n5: VariableGet [VarName=PointB]
NODE n6: GetActorLocation
NODE n7: Lerp [Alpha=0.02]
NODE n8: Lerp [Alpha=0.02]
NODE n9: SetActorLocation
NODE n10: SetActorLocation
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n3.True -> n9.Execute
EXEC n3.False -> n10.Execute
DATA n6.ReturnValue -> n7.A [Vector]
DATA n4.Value -> n7.B [Vector]
DATA n7.ReturnValue -> n9.NewLocation [Vector]
DATA n6.ReturnValue -> n8.A [Vector]
DATA n5.Value -> n8.B [Vector]
DATA n8.ReturnValue -> n10.NewLocation [Vector]
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_PingPong
PARENT: Actor
VAR PointA: Vector = (X=0,Y=100,Z=0)
VAR PointB: Vector = (X=200,Y=-100,Z=0)
VAR AtA: Bool = true
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=AtA]
NODE n3: Branch
NODE n4: GetActorLocation
NODE n5: VariableGet [VarName=PointA]
NODE n6: VSize
NODE n7: LessThan [B=50.0]
NODE n8: SetActorLocation
NODE n9: VariableSet [VarName=AtA]
NODE n10: VariableGet [VarName=PointB]
NODE n11: VSize
NODE n12: LessThan [B=50.0]
NODE n13: SetActorLocation
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n3.True -> n8.Execute
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n6.A [Vector]
DATA n5.Value -> n6.B [Vector]
DATA n6.ReturnValue -> n7.A [Float]
EXEC n7.ReturnValue -> n9.Execute
DATA false -> n9.Value [Bool]
EXEC n3.False -> n13.Execute
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n11.A [Vector]
DATA n10.Value -> n11.B [Vector]
DATA n11.ReturnValue -> n12.A [Float]
DATA false -> n12.B [Float]
EXEC n12.ReturnValue -> n9.Execute
DATA true -> n9.Value [Bool] }
raw_output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_PingPong
PARENT: Actor
VAR PointA: Vector = (X=0,Y=100,Z=0)
VAR PointB: Vector = (X=200,Y=-100,Z=0)
VAR AtA: Bool = true
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=AtA]
NODE n3: Branch
NODE n4: GetActorLocation
NODE n5: VariableGet [VarName=PointA]
NODE n6: VSize
NODE n7: LessThan [B=50.0]
NODE n8: SetActorLocation
NODE n9: VariableSet [VarName=AtA]
NODE n10: VariableGet [VarName=PointB]
NODE n11: VSize
NODE n12: LessThan [B=50.0]
NODE n13: SetActorLocation
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n3.True -> n8.Execute
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n6.A [Vector]
DATA n5.Value -> n6.B [Vector]
DATA n6.ReturnValue -> n7.A [Float]
EXEC n7.ReturnValue -> n9.Execute
DATA false -> n9.Value [Bool]
EXEC n3.False -> n13.Execute
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n11.A [Vector]
DATA n10.Value -> n11.B [Vector]
DATA n11.ReturnValue -> n12.A [Float]
DATA false -> n12.B [Float]
EXEC n12.ReturnValue -> n9.Execute
DATA true -> n9.Value [Bool] }

validation.error:
Line 0: Found 3 parse errors:
Line 27: Invalid DATA syntax | 'DATA false -> n9.Value [Bool]'
Line 32: Invalid DATA syntax | 'DATA false -> n12.B [Float]'
Line 34: Invalid DATA syntax | 'DATA true -> n9.Value [Bool] }' | ''

instruction: Create a Blueprint that on BeginPlay waits 3 seconds, then enables physics simulation and prints Physics Enabled.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_DelayedPhysics
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: Delay [Duration=3.0]
NODE n3: SetSimulatePhysics [Simulate=true]
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Physics Enabled"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.Completed -> n3.Execute
EXEC n3.Then -> n4.Execute
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_DelayedPhysics
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: Delay [Duration=3.0]
NODE n3: SetSimulatePhysics [Simulate=true]
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Physics Enabled"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.Completed -> n3.Execute
EXEC n3.Then -> n4.Execute }
raw_output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_DelayedPhysics
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: Delay [Duration=3.0]
NODE n3: SetSimulatePhysics [Simulate=true]
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Physics Enabled"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.Completed -> n3.Execute
EXEC n3.Then -> n4.Execute }

instruction: Create a Blueprint that on Tick rotates 1 degree on Yaw and moves forward 1 unit. This makes the actor move in a circle.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_CircleMover
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: AddActorLocalRotation [DeltaRotation=(Pitch=0,Yaw=1.0,Roll=0)]
NODE n3: AddActorLocalOffset [DeltaLocation=(X=1.0,Y=0,Z=0)]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.Then -> n3.Execute
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_CircleMovement
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: GetWorldDeltaSeconds
NODE n3: MultiplyFloat [B=1.0]
NODE n4: MakeRotator [Roll=0.0, Pitch=0.0, Yaw=1.0]
NODE n5: AddActorLocalRotation
NODE n6: MultiplyFloat [B=1.0]
NODE n7: GetActorForwardVector
NODE n8: AddActorLocalOffset
EXEC n1.Then -> n5.Execute
DATA n1.DeltaSeconds -> n3.A [Float]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.Yaw [Float]
EXEC n5.Then -> n8.Execute
DATA n7.ReturnValue -> n8.DeltaLocation [Vector] }
raw_output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_CircleMovement
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: GetWorldDeltaSeconds
NODE n3: MultiplyFloat [B=1.0]
NODE n4: MakeRotator [Roll=0.0, Pitch=0.0, Yaw=1.0]
NODE n5: AddActorLocalRotation
NODE n6: MultiplyFloat [B=1.0]
NODE n7: GetActorForwardVector
NODE n8: AddActorLocalOffset
EXEC n1.Then -> n5.Execute
DATA n1.DeltaSeconds -> n3.A [Float]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.Yaw [Float]
EXEC n5.Then -> n8.Execute
DATA n7.ReturnValue -> n8.DeltaLocation [Vector] }

instruction: Create a Blueprint with a boolean IsHeavy. On overlap, if IsHeavy add force of 5000 upward, else add force of 1000 upward.

NODE n5: AddImpulse [Impulse=(X=0,Y=0,Z=1000)]

EXEC n3.False -> n5.Execute

instruction: Create a Blueprint that on overlap adds a downward force of 3000 to the overlapping actor every tick while they remain overlapped. On end overlap, stop.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_GravityZone
PARENT: Actor
VAR IsOverlapping: Bool = false
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n2: VariableSet [VarName=IsOverlapping]
NODE n3: Event_ActorEndOverlap
NODE n4: VariableSet [VarName=IsOverlapping]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
DATA true -> n2.Value [Bool]
EXEC n3.Then -> n4.Execute
DATA false -> n4.Value [Bool]
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_ContinuousDownwardForce
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n2: GetWorldDeltaSeconds
NODE n3: MultiplyFloat [B=3000.0]
NODE n4: AddImpulse
NODE n5: Event_Tick
NODE n6: Event_ActorEndOverlap
NODE n7: SetTimerByFunctionName [FunctionName="Tick", Time=-1.0, Looping=false]
EXEC n1.Then -> n5.Execute
EXEC n5.Then -> n4.Execute
DATA n1.OtherActor -> n4_Other [Actor]
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.A [Float]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4_Impulse [Vector]>

EXEC n5.Then -> n4.Execute

instruction: Create a Blueprint that on Tick gets the actor location. If the Z position is below 0, set it to 0 using SetActorLocation. Print Clamped when this happens.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_FloorClamp
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: GetActorLocation
NODE n3: BreakVector
NODE n4: LessThan [B=0.0]
NODE n5: Branch
NODE n6: MakeVector [Z=0.0]
NODE n7: SetActorLocation
NODE n8: PrintString [InString="Clamped"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n5.Execute
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.Input [Vector]
DATA n3.Z -> n4.A [Float]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n5.True -> n7.Execute
DATA n3.X -> n6.X [Float]
DATA n3.Y -> n6.Y [Float]
DATA n6.ReturnValue -> n7.NewLocation [Vector]
EXEC n7.Then -> n8.Execute
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_ClampZ
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: GetActorLocation
NODE n3: LessThan [B=0.0]
NODE n4: Branch
NODE n5: SetActorLocation
NODE n6: PrintString [InString="Clamped"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n4.Execute
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.A [Float]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n4.True -> n5.Execute
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n5.NewLocation [Vector]
EXEC n5.Then -> n6.Execute }
raw_output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_ClampZ
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: GetActorLocation
NODE n3: LessThan [B=0.0]
NODE n4: Branch
NODE n5: SetActorLocation
NODE n6: PrintString [InString="Clamped"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n4.Execute
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.A [Float]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n4.True -> n5.Execute
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n5.NewLocation [Vector]
EXEC n5.Then -> n6.Execute }

instruction: Create a Blueprint where pressing Fire uses a MultiGate with 3 outputs. Output 0 adds impulse right, output 1 adds impulse left, output 2 adds impulse up.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_MultiImpulse
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Fire"]
NODE n2: MultiGate
NODE n3: AddImpulse [Impulse=(X=0,Y=500,Z=0)]
NODE n4: AddImpulse [Impulse=(X=0,Y=-500,Z=0)]
NODE n5: AddImpulse [Impulse=(X=0,Y=0,Z=500)]
EXEC n1.Pressed -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.Out_0 -> n3.Execute
EXEC n2.Out_1 -> n4.Execute
EXEC n2.Out_2 -> n5.Execute
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_MultiImpulse
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Fire"]
NODE n2: MultiGate
NODE n3: AddImpulse [Impulse=(X=1000,Y=0,Z=0)]
NODE n4: AddImpulse [Impulse=(X=-1000,Y=0,Z=0)]
NODE n5: AddImpulse [Impulse=(X=0,Y=0,Z=1000)]
EXEC n1.Pressed -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.Out_0 -> n3.Execute
EXEC n2.Out_1 -> n4.Execute
EXEC n2.Out_2 -> n5.Execute }

NODE n2: MultiGate

NODE n4: AddImpulse [Impulse=(X=-1000,Y=0,Z=0)]
NODE n5: AddImpulse [Impulse=(X=0,Y=0,Z=1000)]
EXEC n1.Pressed -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.Out_0 -> n3.Execute
EXEC n2.Out_1 -> n4.Execute
EXEC n2.Out_2 -> n5.Execute }

instruction: Create a Blueprint that on Tick moves the actor up and down using a sine wave. Get game time, apply sine, multiply by 100, set the Z location.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_SineWave
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: GetGameTimeInSeconds
NODE n3: Sin
NODE n4: MultiplyFloat [B=100.0]
NODE n5: GetActorLocation
NODE n6: BreakVector
NODE n7: MakeVector
NODE n8: SetActorLocation
EXEC n1.Then -> n8.Execute
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.Input [Float]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.A [Float]
DATA n5.ReturnValue -> n6.Input [Vector]
DATA n6.X -> n7.X [Float]
DATA n6.Y -> n7.Y [Float]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n7.Z [Float]
DATA n7.ReturnValue -> n8.NewLocation [Vector]
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_SineWave
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: GetGameTimeInSeconds
NODE n3: Sin [Period=4.0]
NODE n4: MultiplyFloat [B=100.0]
NODE n5: SetActorLocation [NewLocation=(X=0,Y=0,Z=-1)] // negative to move downward
EXEC n1.Then -> n5.Execute
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.Input [Float]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.A [Float]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.NewLocation.Z [Float] {

GRAPH: EventGraph

NODE n2: GetGameTimeInSeconds
NODE n3: Sin [Period=4.0]
NODE n4: MultiplyFloat [B=100.0]
NODE n5: SetActorLocation [NewLocation=(X=0,Y=0,Z=-1)] // negative to move downward
EXEC n1.Then -> n5.Execute
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.Input [Float]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.A [Float]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.NewLocation.Z [Float] {

extra_lines: NODE n5: SetActorLocation [NewLocation=(X=0,Y=0,Z=-1)] // negative to move downward

instruction: Create a Blueprint that on BeginPlay enables physics and adds a forward impulse of 3000. After 5 seconds, destroy itself.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_Projectile
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: SetSimulatePhysics [Simulate=true]
NODE n3: GetActorForwardVector
NODE n4: MultiplyFloat [B=3000.0]
NODE n5: AddImpulse
NODE n6: Delay [Duration=5.0]
NODE n7: DestroyActor
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.Then -> n5.Execute
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.A [Vector]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.Impulse [Vector]
EXEC n5.Then -> n6.Execute
EXEC n6.Completed -> n7.Execute
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_SelfDestruct
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: SetSimulatePhysics [Simulate=true]
NODE n3: AddImpulse [Impulse=(X=0,Y=0,Z=3000)]
NODE n4: Delay [Duration=5.0]
NODE n5: DestroyActor []
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.Then -> n3.Execute
EXEC n3.Then -> n4.Execute
EXEC n4.Completed -> n5.Execute }
raw_output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_SelfDestruct
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: SetSimulatePhysics [Simulate=true]
NODE n3: AddImpulse [Impulse=(X=0,Y=0,Z=3000)]
NODE n4: Delay [Duration=5.0]
NODE n5: DestroyActor []
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.Then -> n3.Execute
EXEC n3.Then -> n4.Execute
EXEC n4.Completed -> n5.Execute }

instruction: Create a Blueprint with a float variable Speed at 100. On Tick, multiply Speed by DeltaSeconds, move actor forward by that amount. On pressing SpeedUp, add 50 to Speed.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_Accelerator
PARENT: Actor
VAR Speed: Float = 100.0
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=Speed]
NODE n3: MultiplyFloat
NODE n4: MakeVector [Y=0, Z=0]
NODE n5: AddActorLocalOffset
NODE n6: Event_InputAction [ActionName="SpeedUp"]
NODE n7: VariableGet [VarName=Speed]
NODE n8: AddFloat [B=50.0]
NODE n9: VariableSet [VarName=Speed]
EXEC n1.Then -> n5.Execute
DATA n1.DeltaSeconds -> n3.A [Float]
DATA n2.Value -> n3.B [Float]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.X [Float]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.DeltaLocation [Vector]
EXEC n6.Pressed -> n9.Execute
DATA n7.Value -> n8.A [Float]
DATA n8.ReturnValue -> n9.Value [Float]
actual_dsl:

DATA n1.DeltaSeconds -> n3.A [Float]

DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.X [Float]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.DeltaLocation [Vector]
EXEC n6.Pressed -> n9.Execute
DATA n7.Value -> n8.A [Float]
DATA n8.ReturnValue -> n9.Value [Float] }
